Inspection: shortening of the thigh, symmetry of skin folds

Search for abduction limitations (norm > 60°)

Search for hip instability: Barlow manoeuvre (jerk)

question.question: Which of the following is a primary screening procedure for detecting congenital hip dislocation in infants?
question.option_a: Checking for symmetry in the length of the legs
question.option_b: Assessing the range of motion in the knee joints
question.option_c: Performing the Barlow manoeuvre to check for hip instability
question.option_d: Evaluating the symmetry of the ear lobes
